column1: At last the great folding doors were thrown open. Summer announced that dinner was served
column2: and a long procession of old and young being quickly formed
column3: led by Mrs. November and her daughter Thanksgiving
column5: they filed into the spacious dining room
column6: where stood the long table groaning beneath its weight of good things
column7: while four attendants ran continually in and out bringing more substantials and delicacies to grace the board and please the appetite. Winter staggered beneath great trenchers of meat and poultry
column8: pies and puddings; Spring brought the earliest and freshest vegetables; Summer
column9: the richest creams and ices; while Autumn served the guests with fruit
column10: and poured the sparkling wine.All were jolly
column11: and many a joke was cracked as the contents of each plate and dish melted away like snow before the sun; and the great fires roared in the wide chimneys as though singing a glad Thanksgiving song.
